If your pesto darkens in color, it will still taste good. I freeze it by dropping tablespoons of it on a parchment paper, freezing it and storing in a zip lock bag in the freezer.

In a large saucepan, heat olive oil and gently cook onion without browning, for 3-4 minutes. Add pumpkin, carrot and rosemary and cook, stirring for 2-3 minutes. Add stock and bay leaves. Bring to the boil, cover and simmer for 12-15 minutes until vegetables are tender. Remove any rosemary stalks and bay leaves. Place a third of the soup in the blender with a third of the skim milk powder and puree. Pour into a large bowl. Repeat with the remaining soup and milk powder and pour the whole lot back into the saucepan, heat through and serve. For vegetarian use vegetable stock.
Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add butter, onion, and garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 3 to 4 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender.

Cover potatoes with water and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer uncovered 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Drain and cool slightly. While potatoes are cooking, combine remaining ingredients in a large bowl. Add potatoes and toss to coat. Season, if desired, with salt and ground black pepper.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Combine the flours with the salt in a medium bowl. Add the milk, butter and eggs and whisk to combine thoroughly. Pour into well-greased muffin cups or a popover pan. Bake at 450 for 20 minutes, turn oven to 350 degrees and bake 15 minutes longer.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add carrots, zucchini and garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, for about 5 minutes or until just barely tender. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in fresh herbs. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. Lightly spray a baking sheet with vegetable oil spray and set aside. Sprinkle mayonnaise, water and hot pepper sauce in shallow bowl, mixing well. Dip fish in mayonnaise mixture and then dredge in bread crumbs. Place fish on greased baking sheet and bake in oven 17-18 or until fish flakes easily. Serve with lemon wedges.
Combine all ingredients well in crock pot. Cover with foil-bake for 1 hour.

In a large bowl cream together butter, sugars and vanilla. Beat in egg. Mix in flour, baking soda, and salt. Stir in oatmeal and chocolate chips until well blended. On a baking sheet place a ball of dough 2 inches between each other. Bake at 350 degrees f. For about 8-10 minutes.
Heat olive oil over medium heat in medium-sized saucepan. Saute onions and garlic until brown. Add garlic and

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix all ingredients, except flour, sugar, butter, salt, eggs, karo light corn syrup, vanilla, pecanspreparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix all ingredients, except flour, sugar, butter, salt, eggs, karo light corn syrup,

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the butter, white wine, lemon juice, garlic, and parsley. When the butter melts completely, remove from heat. Arrange shrimp in a shallow baking dish. Pour the butter mixture over the shrimp. Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes or until the shrimp are pink and opaque. Serve over rice or pasta.

Add all ingredients to the pan according to the order in the manufacturers directions, with the water and the sour cream put in first, and adding the dry ingredients in on top. Set crust on medium and program for the basic cycle. Press start. When the baking cycle ends, immediately remove the bread from the pan and place it on a rack. Let cool to room temperature before slicing.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, salt and sugar. In a medium bowl, stir together melted butter, ricotta, milk, eggs and vanilla until smooth. Pour into dry ingredients and mix until just combined. Fold in berries. Distribute batter evenly into prepared muffin cups. Bake for 18-22 minutes, until a tester inserted into the cake part comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack. Refrigerate in an airtight container. Cakes will stay moist for several days.

In a large bowl, combine the mashed potatoes, ricotta cheese, chives, garlic. Shape mixture into 8 patties. Roll in bread crumbs. Place on broiler pan. Broil for 10 minutes or until delicately browned.

In a wok or large frying pan over medium high heat, saute the chinese beef and greens in oil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Transfer to a platter in the same pan, heat the wine and saute the celery or bok choy and mushrooms, stirring constantly, for 3 minutes. Add the rice, scallions and spinach. Heat through. Season with soy sauce or tamari.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray corn with nonstick spray. Bake for 30 minutes at 325 degrees.

In a gallon sized ziploc baggie take all the above listed ingredients. And thrown in any desired chicken pieces. You can use a whole chicken or drunsticks or thighs or breasts. I used about 6-8 thighs and marinate at least 4 hours overnight is better turning every 4 hours or so. Heat a grill on one side on medium high heat making sure to place the chicken on the side of the grill that doesnt have fire underneath as the oil will cause it to flame and burn cook untill 165 degrees or juices run clear. Cooking times will vary depending on the grill you use my grill is a charcoal grill and took about 20-35 minutes depending on breast size you will need to adjust accordingly also i prefer to let my chicken set just a minute or 2 before servig i also served this with my quick and easy mederterainian rice recipe.

Put peas, cornstarch, plain flour, baking powder, milk, eggs, halloumi cheese, mint, parmesan cheese, extra virgin olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add peas, cornstarch, plain flour, baking powder, milk, eggs, halloumi cheese, mint, parmesan cheese, extra virgin olive oil to saucepan over medium-high heat. Add

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Place crust on an ungreased 14 in pizza pan. In a small bowl, combine cheese, mayonnaise, onion, garlic and oregano. Spread over crust. Bake at 450 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cut into wedges and serve warm or slightly cooled.

In a small saucepan, mix sugar and cornstarch then whisk in soda until smooth. Bring to a boil and cook while stirring for 1 minute or until thickened. Cover and refrigerate until cool. In a large bowl, combine the oranges, grapefruit and grapes. Add the sauce and stir until fruit is coated.

Preheat oven to 400f. Cut off the ends of the brussels sprouts and pull off any yellow outer leaves. Mix them in a bowl with the olive oil, salt, and lemon-pepper seasoning. Transfer them to a sheet pan and roast for 35 to 40 minutes, until crisp outside and tender inside. Shake the pan from time to time to brown the brussels sprouts evenly. Sprinkle with more kosher salt, if you like, and serve hot.

Place chicken breast halves in a resealable plastic bag set in a shallow dish. For marinade, stir together lime peel, lime juice, oil, thyme, pepper, salt, garlic cloves, salsa, lime wedgepreparation:Place chicken breast halves in a resealable plastic bag set in a shallow dish. For marinade, stir together lime peel, lime juice,

Place chicken in a lightly greased shallow baking dish. Season with the taco seasoning mix. Pour the salsa over the chicken. Bake at 350 for 35 to 45 minutes, or until chicken is tender. When ready to serve, remove the chicken from the pan, stir sour cream into salsa, then return chicken. Serve salsa ranch chicken with a big tossed salad and spanish rice. This chicken breast recipe serves 4.

In a large sauce pan, combine raspberry and water. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer over medium heat until raspberry is tender, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in gelatin and sugar until dissolved. Add frozen strawberries and ice cream. Alow to thaw, stirring occasionally. Pour into indivitual servind dishes. Refrigerate several hours or until firm. Serve with a garnish of whipped cream on top.

In a 2 quart saucepan, add green beans in enough water just to cover them, and bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer, uncovered about 15 minutes or until crisp tender. Drain and immediately rinse with cool water to stop cooking. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet, cook bacon over medium-high heat until crisp. Stirring frequently. Reserve 1 tablespoon of bacon fat and drain off the rest and place bacon on plate covered with paper towels. In the same skillet add onion and 1 tablespoon bacon fat and cook over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until tender. Stir in tomato, garlic, oregano, salt and pepper into onions and simmer about 5 minutes. Stir in green beans and heat through. Add bacon and stir to blend. Transfer mixture to serving dish and drizzle with lemon or lime juice.

Saute onion in a large skillet over medium high heat. Sautee chicken, onion and garlic until onion softens and chicken begins to brown crisp on edges, about 8-12 minutes. Salt and pepper to taste. Reduce heat to medium. Stir in tomatoes, chiles and cumin. If needed add enough water just to make the mixture a little soupy. Continue to cook, stirring occassionally, until liquid is reduced. Mixture should be moist, not wet or dry. Use immediately or freeze for later.
Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Combine ingredients. Pour into pie crust. Bake 15 minute at 425. Reduce heat to 350 degrees and bake 45 minutes. Cool and garnish with whipped cream.

Stir water, freshly squeezed lemon juice and sugar until sugar is disolved. Add lemon rounds to mixture. With sharp knife, poke 5-10 holes in whole jalapeno and add to jelly. Put in fridge to chill for 30 minutes. Serve over ice.
Combine frozen salad shrimp, mayonnaise, ketchup, garlic salt, worcestershire sauce, green bell pepper, tabasco sauce, old bay seasoning in a large bowl. Whisk together mayonnaise,
In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook orzo 5 minutes. Add sugar snap peas and squash. Cook until orzo is al dente and vegetables are crisp-tender, about 3 minutes. Drain well. Return to pot

Preheat the oven to 350f. Mix the chicken, chilies, and salsa in a small bowl. Mix the salt and cream in a large shallow dish. Heat the oil in a frying pan over med-high. Fry the tortillas one at a time for a few seconds until they start to blister and turn soft. Immediately dip each one in the cream mixture. Put a large dollop of the chicken mixture on each tortilla and roll it up. Place it in a ungreased baking pan, flap side down. When all of the tortillas are done, pour the remaining cream over them and sprinkle the cheese over the top. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes or so, until they are thoroughly heated.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly grease cookie sheet. Beat sugar and shortening until creamy. Beat in egg, milk and orange extract. Stir in flour and baking powder. Add cereal and nuts. Mix well. Drop by tablespoon onto prepared cookie sheet. Bake 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Let stand 1 minute before removing to racks to cool.

In a large sauce pan. Add the salt, cayenne pepper, raw shrimp, canola oil, garlic, green onion, snow peas, vegetables, chicken broth, lemon, zest of. Bring to a slight boil. Add shrimp and fresh or frozen but thawed broccoli florets. Take some of the excess sauce and pour into a bowl. Whisk and return to pan. Bring to full boil and stir constantly. As soon as thickening begins, remove from heat and serve over white rice. You may also use one of them premade asian vegetable medleys in this recipe and pour sauce over it. Can be used for beef, chicken or pork as well.

Preheat oven to 350-degrees f. Grease a 9 x 13 inch pan. Combine first seven ingredients in a large bowl. Stir in green chilies and red bell pepper. Pour mixture into prepared pan. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until it is lightly browned and toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.

In a small saucepan over moderately low heat, melt 1 stick of the butter. Continue heating, swirling the pan to prevent burning, until the butter turns nut brown. Transfer the butter to a medium bowl. Using an electric mixer on low speed, gradually blend in the powdered sugar and salt alternately with the milk and vanilla, until the frosting is smooth. Beat in the remaining butter, bit by bit. Refrigerate until mixture is cool and thick enough to spread. Keep frosted cake or cupcakes refridgerated, since the frosting has a tendency to soften and drip off the sides if it gets too warm.
Dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Stir in ice cream until melted. Add strawberries and cake broken into small pieces. Chill until set. Slice in squares. Top with whipped cream.

In a large bowl, combine the egg noodles, instant minced onion, brown gravy mix, salt, pepper, onion soup mix, chili powder, flour tortillas. Add onion and celery back in. Add can of diced tomatoes, a can of water and the pasta. Bring to boil, simmer uuntil pasta is soft and water is gone. Mix in onion soup mix. Mix in cheddar cheese. Serve.

Place all ingredients in a sauce pot. Cook on high heat until mixture starts to boil. Stirring occasionally until cranberries pop. Lower heat to medium and using the back of a large wooden spoon, squeeze the grapes against the side of pot or use a potato masher to pop grapes, leaving some whole. The pectin from the grapes and sugar will thicken the sauce as well as the heat the reducing the mixture.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Mash bananas. Add the other ingredients and mix until all ingredients are combined. Spray muffin tins. Bake for 18-20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place the fish fillets in a baking pan coated with cooking spray. Salt and pepper to taste. Combine the tomatoes, artichoke hearts, olives, and feta cheese. Top the fish with the mixture. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until the fish flakes easily.

In a large skillet combine carrots, water, and 1 tablespoon of the butter. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat to medium. Cover and cook for 6 to 8 minutes or until carrots are nearly tender. Drain. Return to skillet. In a small bowl combine honey, orange juice, ginger, salt, and nutmeg. Pour over carrots. Add the remaining butter. Cook, uncovered, 5 to 6 minutes more or until carrots are tender, stirring to glaze carrots. Just before serving, sprinkle with parsley.

Preheat oven to 425 degree f. Put entire stick butter into a 9 x 13 inch pan. Put pan with butter into the oven until butter is melted. Beat the eggs, milk, and salt until frothy. Add flour. Beat until combined. Pour over melted butter. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes. Serve with syrup or jelly.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spray 9 by 13-inch casserole dish with pam. Place broccoli, garlic salt and pepper in a bag and toss. Place in casserole dish and top with cheddar cheese. Cover and bake for 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Sprinkle cheese in 9x9 inch square baking dish. Dot with butter. Mix cream, mustard, salt, and pepper, and pour half of the mixture over the cheese. Pour eggs on top. Pour remaining cream mixture over the eggs. Bake 25 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Preheat

Preheat oven to 400f grease an 8-inch square baking dish. Using a food processor, puree 1 cup corn. In a large nonstick skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in the chorizo. In a large bowl, beat the eggs. Stir in the milk, pureed corn and tortilla crumbs. Add the onion-chorizo mixture and season with salt and pepper. Transfer the mixture to the prepared pan and bake until set and a knife inserted in the center comes out clean, about 25 minutes. Let sit for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with the scallions.

Heat oil in a deep saucepan, add the chicken and sear on both sides until golden brown, about 2 minutes on each side. Remove the chicken and add the onions and garlic and cook another 10 minutes, to allow flavors to meld. Add the lemon juice and cook another 10 minutes, to allow flavors to meld. Add the lemon juice and cook another 10 minutes, to allow

Preheat oven to 180 degrees celsius. Place chopped butter, sugar and vanilla in a bowl and beat until light and creamy. Add egg and beat well. Using a flat knife, mix through flours and coconut until a soft dough forms. Mix chocolate chips into the dough. Using your hands, mould two tablespoons of dough mixture into a flat round. Place rounds on a baking tray that is lined with non stick baking paper. Repeat until all the mixture is used. Bake for 10 minutes or until light golden. Allow to cool on trays.

Heat oil in a large heavy saucepan over medium high heat. Add the shallots, coriander, cumin, coconut milk, cinnamon stick, cloves, kaffir lime leaves and cook, stirring occasionally, until coriander is translucent, about 7 minutes. Add the rice to the pan and cook, stirring until the rice is evenly coated in oil, and beginning to toast, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the water, sugar, salt and saffron to the pan and bring to a boil over medium high heat, then reduce heat to medium low, partially cover the pan and simmer for 10 minutes. Fully cover the pan and simmer for about 10 minutes longer, until water is completely absorbed. Take pan off heat and let stand 5 minutes without removing lid. Fluff with a fork and stir in the pistachios just before serving.

Preheat oven to 425. Place chicken breasts in ungreased baking pan, 9 x 9 x 2. Spread 1 tsp butter on each of the four chicken breasts. Sprinkle salt and paprika on the breasts. Drizzle all with the lemon juice. Bake uncovered 35- 45 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with snipped parsley and serve.

In a medium saucepan, bring 2 cups water, butter, salt, and cumin to a boil over medium-high heat. Stir in rice, and reduce heat to a simmer. Cook, covered, until liquid is absorbed, about 25 minutes. Remove saucepan from heat. Add lime juice and cilantro. Fluff with a fork until combined. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 325f. Cream butter and cheese. Add salt, pepper and flour to butter mixture. Mix briefly with a mixer. Work in rice krispies either with the mixer or by hand. Form into small balls, placing on a cookie sheet. Flatten each ball with a fork. Keep the fork clean by dipping in flour, if necessary. Bake for about 20 minutes.

Mix first 5 ingredients. Shape into patties. Cook and brown patties, add onion, broth and mushrooms. Cover and simmer 10 minutes. Heat onion to boiling. Remove patties. Mix water and cornstarch. Add to skillet and stir until thickened.
Mix cream cheese and add pineapple, pecans, green pepper, onion and salt. Mix and form into ball. Refrigerate overnight. Serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large mixing bowl combine all ingredients until well combined. Spoon into a 1 quart glass casserole dish. Bake for 28-32 minutes until dip is hot bubbly and slightly browning on the top. Serve warm with chips.

Place potatoes in even layer in greased 13x9-inch baking dish. Combine 3 cups cheese, mayonnaise and onion in medium bowl. Spread mixture over potatoes. Sprinkle potato mixture with bacon, peppers and olives. Bake in preheated 350f oven 35 minutes or until bubbly. Top with remaining cheese. Bake 5 minutes more. Make-ahead. Bake in preheated 350f oven 45 minutes or until bubbly.

Preheat oven to 350-degrees f. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add butter, raw peanuts, mild chili powder, ground cumin, white pepper, salt, dried oregano, cayenne pepper, dried cherries. Mix in peanuts and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Sprinkle with coarse salt and chili powder. Mix well and store in a covered jar or tin.

Preheat oven to 325 f. Mash the bananas until they are mostly lump-free. With a hand mixer, beat together the banana, applesauce, eggs, vanilla, and water until creamy. In a separate bowl, sift the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and spices. Gradually add the dry mixture to the wet ingredients, beating well. Pour the batter into a gently oiled and floured 95 inches loaf pan and spread evenly. Bake for 45 minutes or until a toothpick is inserted and comes out clean. Cool completely on wire rack before slicing.
In a nonmetallic bowl, combine bananas, oranges, strawberry, seedless grapes, sour cream, honeydew melon. Add bananas, oranges, strawberry, seedless grapes, sour cream, honeydew melon.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a mixing bowl, beat your butter, powdered sugar, vanilla, flour, salt, pecan halves, hershey chocolate kiss

Place all ingredients in large pitcher with tight-fitting lid. Cover. Bake for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 and bake another 40 min, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Garnish with pecans if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Remove chicken from marinade and discard marinade. Arrange chicken breasts in a shallow baking pan. Season with salt and pepper and roast for 25-30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and the juices run clear when you prick it with a fork.
Place salmon skin side down on grill for 15-20 minutes. You may also broil salmon or chicken for 20-30 minutes.
Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add butter, onion, and garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 3 to 4 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender.
Place cheese cutout on top of sandwich. Place cheese cutout on top of sandwich.

In a large skillet heat the pan on medium heat. Add the butter and melt. Be careful not to burn the butter. Next add the oil. Saute the carrots, stirring frequently until they start to turn golden and are crisp-tender about 10-12 minutes. Do not allow the skillet to turn dry- adding a little apple juice if necessary. When the carrots are crisp-tender add the remaining apple juice and saute mixture until liquid is absorbed. Finally, stir in the lemon juice, chives, toasted almonds, salt and white pepper.
Combine the balsamic vinegar, lemon zest, salt and pepper. Pour dressing over broccoli. Serve immediately.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place fish in baking pan. Mix orange juice and butter. Pour half this mixture over the fish. Sprinkle the rind over. Bake for 10 minutes. Pour remaining orange

Preheat oven to 350 degrees farenheit. Dice the two eggplants into approximately one inch cubes. Toss the eggplant cubes with 2-4 tbsp of olive oil. Add salt and pepper to taste. Spread into a single layer on a baking sheet and pop into preheated oven. Roast until eggplant is tender and beginning to brown, 15-20 minutes. When eggplant is done roasting, pull out of the oven and top with crushed red pepper, tomato sauce, parmesan, and mozzarella cheese. Place back in oven for approximately 10-15 minutes or until cheese is bubbling and starting to brown slightly. Serve with salad.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Melt the butter in a skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in the mushrooms and onion, and cook until tender. Sprinkle with the flour. Reduce heat to low, and continue cooking 5 minutes. Mix in sour cream and lemon juice, and season with salt and pepper transfer to a small casserole dish, and top with parmesan cheese. Bake 15 minutes in the preheated oven, until bubbly.

Preheat oven to 425f. Mix all ingredients except the cheese together in a bowl. Mold a tbs of meat around a cube of cheese to form a small shaped meatball. Repeat with all of the meat. Spray an edged cookie sheet with nonstick cooking spray and place meatballs on the cookie sheet. Bake for 7-10 min or until meat is done and cheese is melted.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Spray a large rimmed baking sheet with nonstick spray. Combine carrots and all remaining ingredients in large bowl. Toss to coat. Spread in a single layer on prepared baking sheet. Roast cauliflower until tender and lightly caramelized, turning cauliflower over once, 35 to 40 minutes.

Mix all ingredients together in a glass bowl. Place lamb in a extra large heavy-duty plastic bag or glass bowl. Pour the marinade over the lamb, and turn to coat well on all sides. Cover tightly with plastic wrap. Pour the marinade over the lamb, and turn to coat well on all

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix ingredients together in a large bowl. In a medium mixing bowl, beat together banana, brown sugar, butter, and peanut butter until light and fluffy, using a mixer on medium speed. Beat in egg and vanilla. Gradually beat in flour mixture until a dough forms. Shape dough into one inch balls and place them two inches apart on cookie sheets. Using the tines of a fork dipped in flour, press a criss-cross pattern onto each cookie. Bake cookies until edges are set, about 10 minutes. Place cookie sheets on wire racks and cool for about 5 minutes. Then take cookies off the sheets and cool them completely on the wire racks.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Cook chicken until browned stirring often. When done cut into strips. Place back into skillet and add soup, water, corn& tortillas. Bring to a boil. Cover, cook over low heat for 5-6 hours. Remove chicken and shred with two forks. Return chicken to crock pot, reduce to low, and cook for 1-2 hours.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, cream butter, sugar and lemonade mix until fluffy. Beat in egg, vanilla and lemon extract. In a separate bowl, mix flour and baking soda. Add dry ingredients to batter, beating until thoroughly combined. Form dough into 1-inch ball and roll in granulated sugar. Place balls 2-inch apart on well-greased cookie sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until edges begin to brown.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spray baking dish with cooking spray. Season breasts with taco seasoning. Bake breasts uncovered for 20 minutes. Remove from oven, spoon salsa over each piece, taking care not to drench them. Bake uncovered 5 minutes. The ones i used were very thick.

In small bowl, combine sugar with spices. In large bowl, whisk egg whites until frothy. Stir in pecans until coated. Sprinkle with sugar mixture, tossing with spoon to coat nuts evenly. Spread on 2 lightly greased baking sheets and bake in a preheated 325f degree oven, rotating sheets half way through, for 30 minutes or until coating is crisp and nuts are fragrant. Let cool.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Line pastry shell with foil and bake 5 minutes. Remove foil and bake 5 additional minutes. Remove from oven and reduce temperature to 325 degrees. In a bowl, stir together eggs, milk, onion, salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Add vegetables or meat and stir. Toss shredded cheese with flour and add to egg mixture, stirring well. Pour into pastry shell and bake for 35 to 40 minutes. You might want to add foil around the edges to prevent over browning.

Preheat oven to 400f. Peel and cube squash. In a large bowl mix minced garlic and olive oil. Add cubed squash and coat with the oil mixture. Dump all ingredients out of bowl and in to a glass casserole dish. Any size will do really but it will cook faster if it is more spread out. Cook 40-45 minutes, stirring once or twice. Squash is done when it is tender.

Heat oven to 375 degrees. Spray muffin tins with nonstick spray. Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt in a bowl. Mix in beaten eggs, applesauce and melted butter. Evenly scoop mixture into muffin pans. Bake for 18 to 20 minutes. Test to see if toothpick comes out clean.

Cook beans in a 5-quart pot of boiling salted water until crisp-tender, about 5 minutes. Drain in a colander and immediately transfer to a bowl of ice and cold water to stop cooking. Drain and pat dry. Toss beans with oil, salt, and pepper to taste, then toss with lemon juice and half of zest. Serve beans sprinkled with remaining zest.

Preheat oven to 400 f. Combine the oil, garlic, sugar, cumin, salt, cinnamon, and carrots in a shallow baking pan. Roast 20 minutes or until fork-tender. Remove from oven and add the raisins, lemon juice, and parsley. Toss well.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Bake pork chops for about 30 minutes, turning at least once during cooking. Remove cover from pan, bake chops for about 30 minutes, turning at least once during cooking. Remove cover from pan, bake chops for about 30 minutes,

Spray 3 quart slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Rinse rice and drain well. Cover crockpot and cook on high for 3-4 hours. Add mushrooms and thyme and stir gently. Cover and cook on low for 30-60 minutes longer, until wild rice pops and is tender.

Preheat oven to 400f. Spray an 8-inch pie plate with vegetable cooking spray. In a large bowl combine egg with melted butter. Whisk until well combined. Sift together flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder and salt in a small bowl. Combine with egg mixture. Pour in buttermilk and stir until just combined.

Preheat oven to 375. In a bowl with tight fitting lid, put the tomatoes. Add chicken, in batches, and shake to coat. Shake off excess flour and place pieces in a greased 8x8 baking dish,. Making sure not to lay them flat. They should have the same shape as they were in the package. In a small bowl, mix the honey, soy sauce, garlic and seasonings. Pour evenly over the chicken. Cover and bake 30 minutes. Uncover and bake an additional 15 minutes, basting occasionally with the sauce. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large skillet over medium high heat, saute the beef and onion for 5 to 10 minutes, or until meat is browned and onion is tender. Drain fat. Add the celery, chili, tomatoes, taco sauce and corn. Heat thoroughly, reduce heat to low and allow to simmer. Meanwhile, prepare the noodles according to package directions. When cooked, place them in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Pour the meat mixture over the noodles, stirring well. Bake at 350 degrees f for 25 minutes, or until cheese is completely melted and bubbly.

Heat oil in heavy pan then brown short ribs in the oil. Put short ribs in pressure cooker red wine, beef broth, onion,. Garlic, honey, brown sugar, salt and pepper. Bring to high pressure. Cook at high pressure for one hour. Turn off and let steam come down naturally -- do not open cooker until steam is completely released. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly brush both sides of the zucchini with olive oil and place on a foil-lined baking sheet. Mix cheese and herbs together in a small bowl and sprinkle over the zucchini. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Bake for 15 minutes and place under the broiler for the last 3-5 minutes, until cheese is crispy and browned.

Preheat oven to 200c. In a large mixing bowl, mix the eggs, onion, tomato sauce, salt, pepper, ground cumin, ground coriander. Spread this mixture evenly in a baking dish. Pour the crushed tomatoes and any juices over the potatoes. Pour water into the pan. Cover with foil and bake for 45 minutes. After this time, reduce oven temperature to 180c, remove foil and bake an additional 30 minutes until the potatoes are tender and the sauce has thickened.

Heat grill to medium-high heat. Mix mayo and basil. Refrigerate until ready to use. Combine meat and garlic. Shape into 8 thin patties. Top 4 patties with cheese. Cover with remaining patties. Pinch edges together to seal. Grill 7 to 9 minute on each side or until burgers are done. Spread buns with mayo mixture. Fill with lettuce, tomatoes, burgers and peppers.

Mix the graham cracker crumbs, melted butter or margarine and sugar together. Press firmly into a 13x9 inch pan and refridg while making the filling. Beat the graham cracker crumbs, melted butter or margarine and sugar together. Press firmly into a 13x9 inch pan

In a large saucepan over medium high heat, combine the butter, garlic, onion, chicken broth, clams, cream of potato soup, pepper, half-and-half, salt and pepper. Saute for about 3 minutes, add the butter, garlic, onion, chicken broth, clams, cream of potato soup, pepper, half-and-half, salt and pepper. Reduce heat to low and allow soup to simmer for about 20 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender. Add the clams and allow to heat through.

Preheat oven to 450f. Peel potatoes & cut into thick fries or wedges. Spray baking sheet with cooking spray or cover with rapid release foil. Combine salt, garlic powder, paprika, & pepper and place in large ziploc bacg. Drizzle olive oil over potatoes and coat evenly. Place potatoes in bag and shake to coat. Arrange potatoes in single layer on baking sheet. Bake 35 minutes or until golden brown.

In a small saucepan, combine water and agar-agar flakes and bring to a boil. Gently simmer until agar has dissolved completely, about 5 minutes. Add espresso and stir until dissolved. Cool slightly. In a food processor or blender, blend tofu, maple syrup, cocoa powder, vanilla, salt and cooled espresso mixture until completely smooth. Pour into the prepared pie shell. Refrigerate for several hours or overnight until firm. Serve topped with non-dairy topping.

Preheat oven to 180c. In a medium bowl cream butter until fluffy. Add sugars and egg, mix well. In another bowl sift dry ingredients, add to wet ingredients. Once the dry and wet ingredients are well mixed add cup of rolled oats and cup of chocolate chips. Spoon a bit of the batter at a time onto a greased pan. Bake at 350 for 28-32 minutes or until lightly browned and edges start to pull away from sides of pan.

Preheat oven to 325f. In a large mixing bowl, cream your butter and sugars til fluffy and airy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in flour mixture until combined well drop by quarter cup measure on to an ungreased baking sheet. Bake 12 to 13 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from baking sheet and then cool on wire rack.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Prepare stuffing mix according to package directions. Set aside. Place chicken in a greased 2-qt. Baking dish. Combine the soup, sour cream and dry soup mix. Spread over chicken. Sprinkle with mushrooms and water chestnuts. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 30 to 35 minutes or until bubbly.

Heat olive oil in a small pan and fry chili for 3-4 minutes over a low heat. Stir in chopped red pepper. Drain sweet potato and garlic and mash with 2 tbsp cream cheese and milk, adding more if needed. Stir red pepper, chili and coriander into mash. Add salt and black pepper to taste.

Heat olive oil in large frying pan. Add peppers and onions and cook gently for 2-3 minutes, stirring frequently. Add parsley, cilantro and garlic and cook another 2-3 minutes. Add chopped tomatoes and their juice to the pan, stir and season with salt and pepper. Cover the pan and simmer for about 20 minutes or until the peppers are tender but slightly crisp. The sauce should be somewhat thick. If too much liquid remains when the peppers are crisp tender, remove the peppers and onions and boil rapidly to reduce the liquid. Check the seasoning again at this point. Add pepper and mozzarella pasta according to directions on package, drain and cool by running cool water over it. Let drain thoroughly. Combine pepper and mozzarella in small sauce pan. Cook on high heat until bubbly, stirring often. Turn down heat and cover. Simmer at least 30 minutes for best flavor. Cook pasta according to package directions. Sauce may be thinned with water reserved from pasta if desired. Serve with parmesan cheese.

Boil eggs, shell and cut in half lengthwise. In small bowl mash the yolks with a fork. Stir in the sour cream, mayonnaise and the mustard. Stir in the lemon zest, lemon juice and cayenne. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Divide mixture and spoon into the egg halves. Garnish with fresh parsley or thyme. If not eating immediately, cover well and refrigerate.

In a medium saucepan, heat the oil on medium-high heat until shimmering. Put the chili powder into the oil, and stir into a smooth paste. Allow the mixture to form bubbles around the edges. Pour in the orange juice, and stir to combine. Add cumin, honey, or lime, if using, and boil, covered, for 5 minutes. Uncover saucepan and boil until the sauce changes from burnt orange, to red-orange, to brick red. The sauce should be reduced by half. This will take 10 minutes or so. Turn heat to low. If using chocolate, stir in while still hot but not bubbling. Serve or refrigerate.

Preheat oven to 350c. Preheat oven to 350c. Butter a 9 inch springform pan in small bowl, blend butter and sugar, then add vanilla and egg. Beat well add flour, baking powder, and salt to butter mixture. Blend well. Spread dough over bottom and 1 inch up side of pan. Over dough, arrange 5-6 peach slices in center to create a circular shape place rest of slices around center circle to create the effect of sunrays. Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon. Bake 35-45 minutes cool 10 minutes then remove the sides of pan.

Preheat oven to 375. Melt butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and bell pepper. Saut 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in black pepper. Divide onion mixture and turkey evenly among bottom halves of rolls. Top each serving with 1 cheese slice. Cover with top halves of rolls. Place sandwiches on a baking sheet. Bake at 375 for 5 minutes or until cheese melts.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine wild rice, olive oil, mushroom, onion, old cheddar cheese, tomatoes, salt, water, slivered almonds. Bake in a 9x13x2 inch dish. Sprinkle with topping.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix ingredients together in a large bowl until well-blended. Roll dough into tablespoon size balls. Bake 12 minutes for chewy cookies. Bake 15 minutes for crisp.
Combine shrimp, oregano, lemon juice, salt and pepper, garlic, butter, feta cheese, cream, green onion, tomatoes season with pepper. Toss thoroughly. Serve immediately.

In a small saucepan over medium-low heat, saute the garlic until aromatic. Add the garlic, onions, water, butter, heavy cream, fresh cilantro. Scramble the egg, parmesean cheese, hot sauce, salt and pepper in a serving bowl. When the broth comes to a boil, add the garlic, onions, water, butter, heavy cream, fresh cilantro. Scramble

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place chicken breasts on a baking sheet and top each breast with 2 tablespoon of barbeque sauce, 2 tablespoon cheese, 2 tablespoon rotel tomatoes, green onions and 1 tablespoon of bacon bits. Place into the oven and bake until the cheese has melted. Place into the

Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the bacon and croutons. Mix well. Cook just until the bacon is cooked through, stirring constantly. Pour over the spinach mixture, tossing to coat. Season with the salt and pepper. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a greased 10 x 15 cookie sheet evenly with graham crackers. Combine brown sugar and butter and bring to a boil in microwave or on stovetop. Pour mixture over crackers and sprinkle with nuts and chips. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool in refrigerator. Cut or separate into bars.

In a saucepan, combine sweetened condensed milk, lemon juice, crushed pineapple, pecans, cool whip, maraschino cherries, pie shells. Cook and stir over low heat until chocolate melts. Stir in pie filling and extracts. Pour into crust. Chill 2-3 hours or until firm. Garnish with cool whip and cherries.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken wings and cook for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally. Remove lid from pan and continue cooking for 25 minutes, turning the chicken pieces till it is cooked and well coated in the mama s sticky wings. Stir through the coriander leaves and serve with steamed rice and greens.

Preheat oven to 425. Dip chicken in milk, then roll in seasoned flour. Melt butter in 9 x 13 baking dish. Place chicken, skin side down, in butter. Cook 30 minutes. Mix water, remaining milk and soup together. Turn chicken and pour soup mixture over it. Bake 30 minutes more. Remove chicken and stir gravy.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place chicken breasts in ungreased baking pan, 9 x 9 x 2. Spread 1 tsp butter on each of the four chicken breasts. Sprinkle salt and paprika on the breasts. Drizzle all with the lemon juice. Bake uncovered 35- 45 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with snipped parsley and serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Season chicken with the salt and 1 tablespoon of the omani spice mix. Roast chicken on a rack or in a baking dish for 45 minutes until it is cooked through and the skin has browned. Remove from oven and set aside. In a large saucepan, heat the ghee, then add the onions and cook until golden, about 5 or 6 minutes. Add remaining 2 tablespoons of spice mix and garlic. Add the bouillon and water. Once the mixture boils, stir in the rice. Cover, reduce heat and cook on low for about 25 minutes until rice is tender. Serve rice with chicken on top. Garnish with toasted almonds.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Season chicken with the salt and 1 tablespoon of the omani spice mix. Roast chicken on a rack or in a baking dish for 45 minutes until it is cooked through and the skin has browned. Remove from oven and set aside. In a large saucepan, heat the ghee, then add the onions and cook until golden, about 5 or 6 minutes. Add remaining 2 tablespoons of spice mix and garlic. Add the bouillon and water. Once the mixture boils, stir in the rice. Cover, reduce heat and cook on low for about 25 minutes until rice is tender. Serve rice with chicken on top. Garnish with toasted almonds.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease 9 x 5 x3 inch loaf pans, or 1 large one. Stir sugar, butter, eggs, bananas and buttermilk in large bowl. Stir in flour, baking soda, and salt. Stir in blueberries, pour into pan. Bake large pan for 75 minutes, smaller pan from 55-60 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes, remove from pan onto wire rack, cool 2 hours before slicing.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray muffin pan with cooking spray. Beat sugar and eggs together until thickened. Add melted butter and almond extract. Beat well. Add flour. Stir in cranberries and pecans. Fill muffin pan. Since these do not raise much fill the cups to the top. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until browned on top and done in center. Cool on wire rack.

Preheat oven to 350, wrap garlic in foil, roast about 1 hour. Peel and put in a small bowl, and mash. Cook potatoes in pot of boiling water until tender, about 20 minutes, drain. Heat oil in pot over medium heat, add garlic and shallots. Saute 2 minutes. Add to potatoes, mash potatoes with garlic and shallots, add the butter, cheese and sour cream. Season with salt and pepper.

In a saucepan over high heat, bring the broth to a boil. Add the chicken, carrots, peas and scallions. Reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes, or until the carrots are tender. Season with salt and pepper, if desired. Serve, or freeze for later.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a large glass baking dish with foil,. Put the ground beef in a large bowl and add the onion and garlic, knead together, add bread crumbs and italian seasoning -- mix all together. Add the egg and milk -- knead together well with hands --. Form pieces of meat into 1 inch balls, place in baking dish -- bake for about 20-30 minutes --. I usually put them in a large pan on the stove and cover with spaghetti sauce for a few minutes at medium heat, but thats optional.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large mixing bowl, cream your butter and sugars til fluffy and airy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in oats, flour and raisins. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet, about 2-inches apart. Bake 9-11 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from baking sheet and then cool on wire rack.
Heat butter in a large saucepan. Stir in flour and seasonings till smooth and bubbling. Stir in ham and eggs. Heat till hot. Serve on toast.

In a saucepan over low heat, bring the rhubarb, sugar, and 2 cups of water to a boil. Simmer until rhubarb is soft. Mash the berries and add to the rhubarb. Add the rest of the water. Bring to a boil again and remove from heat. Mix the cornstarch and a bit of water separately. Add to the saucepan and let simmer for a few minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Serve with a bit of granulated sugar sprinkled on top.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. In a large bowl, cream both sugars with the shortening, margarine, eggs, and vanilla. Then, gradually add soda, salt and flour. Stir in chocolate chips. Bake 8-9 minutes.

Heat butter in a large pan over low heat. Add sliced onions and cook until soft, translucent and lightly browned, stirring often. Add the sugar and continue stirring until the onions are deep brown in colour. This may take around 20 minutes. Add water and bonox and simmer for 30 minutes. Top each slice of the baguette with a tablespoon of parmesan cheese. Toast baguette under a hot grill until golden brown. Serve baguette on top of the soup, and sprinkle with chopped parsley.

In a heavy saucepan, combine the sugar, margarine, brown sugar, milk, natural-style peanut butter, vanilla extract, icing sugar. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Uncover and cook over medium heat until a candy thermometer reads 238. Remove from heat. Stir in peanut butter and vanilla. With a wooden spoon, beat until thick and creamy, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a buttered 8-inch square dish. Cool and cut into squares.

In large skillet, melt butter, stir in flour, cook 1 minute. Slowly stir in milk, cook until bubbly. Add cheese, salt and pepper, mix well. Remove from heat. Put 3 pieces asparagus on each ham slice. Roll up and place in 13x9 baking pan. Cover with the cheese sauce. Sprinkle with crumbs. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350. Pour melted butter into a 9x13-in baking dish. Add chicken, skin side down, sprinkle with seasoning salt and garlic. Turn chicken over, season and lay bacon strips on top. Sprinkle with mushrooms. Bake in the preheated oven for 45-60 minutes, or until chicken is no longer pink and juices run clear. Remove chicken, bacon and mushrooms to a platter and keep warm. Pour juices from baking dish into a small saucepan and whisk together with cream over low heat until thickened. Pour sauce over chicken and serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place the squash cut side up in a baking dish with inch of water in the bottom of the pan. Cover the dish and bake for 7 minutes more until maple syrup is hot and bubbly. Remove from oven and let cool down for 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese and neufchatel cheese. Stir in the crab. Spoon down the center of each tortilla. Roll up tightly and place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes or until heated through. Serve with salsa.

In electric frying pan or large skillet saute onions and peppers until onions soften. Add corned beef. Continue to cook until cubes fall apart. Add frozen hash browns. Add seasoning if desired. Cook, stirring often until potatoes are done and start to brown.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Cut, seed, and dice peppers, and place into pan. Add olive oil and to peppers and stir around thoroughly. Add minced garlic and stir until thoroughly melted and blended. Transfer into serving dish and serve right away or refrigerate.

In a saucepan, melt butter. Stir in flour until smooth cook and stir over med heat for 2 minutes. Add apple, granny smith apples, canned chicken broth, ground nutmeg, fat-free evaporated milk, dried rosemary, salt, black pepperpreparation:In a saucepan, melt butter. Add apple, granny smith apples, canned chicken broth, ground nutmeg, fat-free evaporated milk, dried rosemary, salt, black pepperpreparation:In a saucepan, melt

Melt butter and while hot, stir in peanut butter. Mix well and add vanilla, powdered sugar and rice krispies. Work in with hands until it will form balls. If using paraffin shred on a box grater then add to the chocolate in a double boil and heat till melted and combined. Dip into melted chocolate and paraffin or shortening with toothpick. Cool on waxed paper.
Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Bake for 30 to 45 minutes until hot and bubbly.
Heat oven to 350 degrees f. Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, just until the filling is warm, and the bread is lightly toasted.

In a large saucepan over low heat, bring the raspberries, cornstarch, granulated sugar, cold water, lemon juice, slivered almonds. Add to the raspberries, cornstarch, granulated sugar, cold water, lemon juice, slivered almonds. Add to the raspberries, cornstarch, granulated sugar, cold

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a large microwave-safe bowl, microwave frozen hash browns for 4 minutes on high. Stir sour cream, butter, onion, soup, and cheese into potatoes. Spread mixture evenly into a greased 9x13 inch pan. Sprinkle corn flakes over top. Bake, uncovered, for 45-50 minutes or until bubbly around edges.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add cauliflower and cook, stirring occasionally, until the cauliflower is a deep golden color, about 20 minutes. Add balsamic vinegar, salt and pepper. Cook until most of the moisture evaporates and cauliflower is deep brown, about 5 minutes. Meanwhile, steam or microwave the cauliflower until tender but still firm. Put cauliflower on a platter and top with caramelized onions. Sprinkle with pine nuts.

Pour 2 cups milk into a medium bowl. Add pudding mix. Beat with an electric mixer 1 minute. Spread mixture evenly into crust. Beat cream cheese, sugar and 1 tablespoon milk with an electric mixer until smooth. Fold in whipped topping on low speed. Spread over chocolate mixture. Sprinkle with chocolate, if desired. Cover with dome. Chill at least 3 hours before serving.

In a wide shallow dish, whisk the egg, yogurt and salt. Brush one side of bread slices with melted butter. Layer the ham, swiss and cheddar on the buttered side of 2 slices of the bread. Top with remaining bread, buttered side inward. Melt 2 tablespoons of butter in a cast iron skillet over medium-low heat. Layer the ham, swiss and cheddar on the buttered
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions and sauté for 1 minute. Add sausage and sauté for 1 minute. Add tomato sauce and sauté for 1 minute

Combine the sugar, butter and butter in a saucepan. Bring mixture to a rolling boil stirring constantly. Remove pan from heat and stir in white chocolate chips until completely melted. Add marshmallow creme and walnuts. Beat by hand until completely blended. Spread into a greased 9x9 pan.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Brush the raspberry mint dressing with 1 teaspoon of the oil, reserving the remaining oil. Roast the raspberry mint dressing in a pan until golden and soft, about 10 to 15 minutes. Watch carefully so raspberry mint does not get over-brown or burn. Carefully remove pan from oven and cool. When cool enough to handle, squeeze out the raspberry mint pulp. Combine the pulp with the reserved olive oil and rest of the ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth and use the dressing on any mixed garden salad. Refrigerate leftover.

Preheat oven broiler. Spray the chicken breasts with olive oil spray and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Broil the chicken breasts for 7 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Chop chicken breasts and put in refrigerator to cool. While oven is still hot, spread your almond flakes on a cookie sheet and toast on the broiling rack. Please keep an eye on them because they toast quickly, and you dont want burnt almonds. Once the chicken is cooled, mix in the almonds, celery, onion, mustard and mayo. You can either put the salad straight onto your choice of bread and add whatever you like on your sandwiches or can be eaten out of iceburg lettuce leaves for a no carb version.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan or 12-cup fluted tube pan with non-stick cooking spray. In large mixing bowl, combine cake mix, eggs, flour, sour cream, sugar, milk, margarine. Beat to mix well. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 1 hour, or until done.

Heat oil in a large cast-iron skillet over medium heat. Add flour, whisking constantly until bubbly, about 1 minute. Slowly whisk in milk until thickened, about 3 minutes. Stir in black pepper, cheese, chipotle peppers, and adobo sauce. Divide steaks and pepper-and-onion mixture among 4 baguette slices. Top with cheese sauce and remaining 4 bread slices. Bake at 375 degrees farenheit for 11-13 minutes, or until rolls are browned. Remove from heat and stir in milk until thickened, about 3 minutes. Stir in black pepper, cheese, chipotle
Heat olive oil over medium heat in medium-sized saucepan. Saute onions and garlic until brown. Add garlic and stir. Reduce heat to medium-low. Add
In a small bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt and pepper. In a small bowl,

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large mixing bowl, combine the first 4 ingredients. In a 2-quart saucepan, heat the honey, oil and vanilla until syrupy. Add to the dry ingredients and mix well. Spread on a jellyroll pan. Bake for 20 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes. Store in a covered container.

Scoop the avocado out of the skin into a bowl. Coarsely mash with fork or potato masher. Add all other ingredients except the lime juice. Lightly blend - authentic guac is chunky, not pureed. Squeeze in lime juice, mix gently and taste for seasoning adjustments.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Brush a large baking dish with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil. Put green beans, onion, and garlic in dish, drizzle with remaining oil and sprinkle with salt. Bake for 25 minutes, stirring beans at least 3 times. When tender, remove beans from oven and transfer to bowl. Immediately drizzle with vinegar. Add hearts of palm, tomatoes, pine nits and pepper to taste and toss. Serve warm or room temperature.
Place pork roast in crock pot. Cover with lid and cook on low heat 8-10 hours. I like to cook mine a long time so they fall apart in the crock pot. Serve with brown rice and a green veggie.
Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Stir in almonds.

Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium. Add onion and cook until softened, stirring occasionally, about 3 minutes. Whisk eggs and hot sauce in a small bowl. Add to hot skillet and cook until eggs set, about 2 minutes. Top with cheese and cook until melted, about 1 minute. Place egg mixture evenly over 4 bagel halves. Top with remaining bagel halves and serve.

Heat oil in a nonstick skillet, add one tortilla. Layer with half the cheddar cheese, all of the chicken and mushrooms and half the monterey jack cheese. Top with the second tortilla. Cover and heat until cheese melts and bottom tortilla is crisp and golden brown. Turn over. Sprinkle remaining cheese on top. Cook until bottom tortilla is crisp and golden brown and cheese is melted. Cut into wedges and serve with sour cream and salsa if desired.

In a large tea pot, place tea bags, orange zest, mint leaves and cloves and then pour boiling water over all. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Cover and let steep until cool. Strain tea through mesh strainer into a large pitcher filled with ice. Stir in grapefruit juice. Serve over ice in large glasses, garnished with mint sprigs, if desired.

In a small bowl, whisk together the garlic, mint, lemon zest and juice, and mustard. While whisking, slowly add the olive oil and whisk until thick and emulsified. Whisk in the sour cream and tabasco sauce. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Put green beans and red onion into a large bowl. Pour the dressing over the beans and toss well. Refrigerate at least 30 minutes or up to 24 hours before serving. The 30 minutes is not cooking time, but is the time allowed to blend the flavors while in the refrigerator.

Place pork in crock pot. Pour can of beef broth over pork. Cook for about 10 hours or until meat shreds easily. Remove pork and shred with two forks. Stir the meat with barbecue sauce in a hot skillet on the stove and serve on hamburger buns.

Preheat oven to 375f grease or line a baking sheet. Cut the crusts off of the bread slices, then cut each piece of bread into 3 equal rectangles. In a small bowl, combine cream cheese, chicken, bacon and salsa. Gently stir until well combined. Spread beef mixture on each tortilla. Roll up and wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate until serving time. To serve, cut beef mixture on each tortilla. To

In a large tea pot, place tea bags, orange zest, mint leaves and cloves and then pour boiling water over all. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Cover and let steep until cool. Strain tea through mesh strainer into a large pitcher filled with ice. Stir in grapefruit juice. Serve over ice in large glasses, garnished with mint sprigs, if desired.

In a 3-quart saucepan, saute the squash, carrots, celery, onion, and ginger in the olive oil until tender. Add the vegetable stock and bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 40 minute stirring occasionally. Puree soup in a blender or food processor. Reheat on stove if necessary. Add salt to taste.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the olives and cook, stirring occasionally, until liquid is thickened and coats olives, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in lemon slices. Transfer to a shallow dish and marinate, chilled, at least 24 hours. These will keep for 1 month if kept in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

Heat oil on medium heat using a large skillet. Add onion, capers, tuna, salt, red pepper flakes, spaghetti, parmesan cheese. Stir-fry about 2 minutes. Stir-fry frequently. Remove from heat & set aside.
Place pork chops in casserole dish. Cover and bake at 350f for 30-90 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a small bowl, soak the apples in brandy for 5 minutes. Blend flour, brown sugar, salt and butter until mixture resembles coarse meal. Add oats and almonds and toss. In a 9 inch glass pie dish, toss together apples, apricots and brandy. Sprinkle oat mixture evenly over top and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until apples are tender and topping is browned.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine all the above ingredients except flour tortillas, cream cheese, ham, dill pickle slices. Spread mixture on ham rolls and roll up with seam side down in baking dish. Melt butter in saucepan. Add flour and blend well. Add milk and continue to stir over medium heat until thick. Add cheddar cheese and continue to stir over medium heat until cheese is melted. Pour sauce over ham rolls and sprinkle with parmesan cheese and paprika, if desired. Cover with foil. Bake 20 minutes covered and 20 minutes uncovered.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Preheat oven to 350 degrees.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix flour, baking powder, salt, nutmeg, butter, vanilla, sugar, eggs, mashed banana, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, buttermilk, but

Preheat oven to 350-degrees f. Grease a 9 x 13 inch pan. Combine first seven ingredients in a large bowl. Stir in white rice, ground sausage, salsa, light sour cream, cheddar cheese, eggs, salt and pepper. Pour mixture into prepared pan. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until it is lightly browned and toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Bake for 30

Melt butter over low heat. Stir in nutella and sugar. Gradually stir in cream. Cook and stir over medium heat for 3 - 4 minutes until mixture is thick and sugar is completely dissolved, stirring after 3 minutes. Stir in vanilla. Let cool before refrigerating.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the mushrooms are cooked through. Remove from heat and serve.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add capers and garlic. Cook stirring fo r1-2 minutes. Add shrimp, tomatoes, oregano and tarragon to skillet and saute for 5-6 minutes, stirring occasionally or until shrimp is pink. Remove from heat and stir in feta cheese. Toss to combine. Spoon pasta mixture over the orzo. Toss.

Preheat oven to 350f. Line an 8-inch pie pan or heatproof baking dish with the pie dough. Prick the dough with the tines of a fork. In a second bowl, mix together the apples, cup of the sugar, and the unsalted butter. Work these ingredients together with a fork until you have a crumbly mixture. Fill the pie crust with the apple mixture and smooth over the surface. Spoon the crumble over the apple mixture so that the apples are completely covered. Sprinkle the remaining tablespoon of sugar and teaspoon of cinnamon over the crumble. Bake for 25 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Cover a baking sheet with parchment paper. Wash and cut potatoes into somewhat uniform chunks. Pat dry. Crush and break rosemary and thyme leaves by hand. Put potatoes, olive oil, rosemary and thyme into a container with a lid and shake well to coat the potatoes. Spread potatoes on baking sheet in a single layer. Salt and pepper to taste. Bake 45 - 60 minutes or until nicely brown, stirring and turning occasionally.

Place potatoes in an 8 inch square baking dish which has been wiped down with shortening or sprayed with pam. Potatoes will thaw over night in the fridge. Sprinkle dish with cheese, ham and onions. In a separate bowl, beate eggs, evaporated milk, pepper and salt together. Pour into baking dish over the potato mixture. Cover and refridgerate for several hours or overnight. Remove from refridgerator 30 minutes before baking. Bake, uncovered, at 350 for 55-60 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean.

Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a pan, add the mushrooms and cook over medium heat for 2-3 minutes, or until the mushrooms have softened. Toss the mushrooms in a large bowl with the shredded chicken. Combine all the lime and soy dressing ingredients in a small jug or bowl, mix well and pour two-thirds of the dressing over the warm mushrooms. Arrange the salad leaves in a serving dish and toss through the remaining dressing. Top with the chicken and mushrooms and serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350f. Spread butter, feta cheese, french bread, kalamata olives, oregano leaves on top of mediterranean bread crisps. Bake at 350f. Spread butter, feta cheese, french bread, kalamata olives, oregano leaves on top of mediterranean

In a saucepan, melt butter. Stir in flour until smooth cook and stir over med heat for 2 minutes. Add crabmeat, margarine, flour, chicken broth, milk, old bay seasoning, salt & pepper to taste. Simmer for at least 5 minutes but do not boil. Garnish with chopped parsley and very thin slices of crab.

In a small saucepan, heat butter and oil over medium-high heat. Saute onion until softened, about 5 minutes. Add cous cous, curry powder, cumin, cayenne pepper, couscous, chicken broth, salt, pepper and cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add chicken broth, stir to incorporate, and bring to boiling point. Cover pan, remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with fork, season with salt if needed, and serve hot.

Combine the first 5 ingredients in a heavy pot and bring to a boil over medium high heat. When it comes to a full rolling boil that cannot be stirred down, reduce heat and simmer until it comes to the softball stage or 236f on a candy thermometer. Remove from heat and stir in cinnamon, allspice, margarine, and vanilla. Cool, then beat until thick and mixture looses its gloss. Pour into buttered square dish and let cool before cutting.

Mix all ingredients together in a small measuring cup. Place venison steaks in a large zip lock bag. Pour marinade over steaks and seal bag. Place bag in a flat casserole dish so that the steaks are in a single layer. Refrigerate and marinate at least 4 hours, turning every half hour to marinate each side. Drain marinade and grill steaks to desired doneness. I double or triple this recipe for each addition package of steak. Any wild game steak can be used in this recipe.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Put the first 7 ingredients into a food processor bowl. Pulse until bread is very coarsely chopped, 4-6 times. Grease an 8 inch square baking dish and arrange the cherry tomatoes in a single layer. Sprinkle with the bread crumb mixture. Bake until crust is browned and tomatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350f. Place chips on a foil-lined baking sheet. Top with salsa, beans, scallions and cheese. Heat until cheese is melted. Top with guacamole. Enjoy with vegetable sticks dipped in dressing.

Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the eggs, break the yolks with a spatula, and allow the eggs to set. Occasionally lift the edges of the eggs to let the uncooked egg run underneath. This allows more egg to make contact with the pan for faster cooking. When the eggs have cooked, sprinkle with salt and cumin, and serve.

Put the dumplings in a large saucepan and bring to a boil. Add flour, one tablespoon sugar, salt, and mix well. The dough will be sticky. Divide in 8. Make a square from each part. Wash the plums well, remove the pips and in their place put a little sugar and cinnamon. Put a plum on each square and

In 4-quart saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Cook onion and garlic in butter 2 to 3 minutes, stirring frequently, until tender. Stir in flour, salt and pepper. Cook, stirring constantly, 1 minute. Stir in broth, broccoli and corn. Heat to boiling over high heat. Reduce heat. Simmer 5 to 7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender. Stir in half-and-half. Cook 2 to 3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until hot.

Place beef in slowcooker. Add sliced onions. Mix together the vegetable juice, brown gravy mix, garlic, pepper and thyme. Pour liquid mix over beef in slowcooker. Cover with the lid and cook on low for about 7-8 hours or until desired doneness.

In small saucepan, combine milk and lemon juice. Mix well. Mixture should thicken. Add water and lemon juice. Stir until smooth. Cook and stir 1-2 minutes longer or until thickened. Remove from heat. Cool clightly. Pour into crust. Refrigerate for 3 hours or until set. Spread with whipped topping.

Place ingredients in bread machine pan in recommended order and set on dough cycle. Check consistency of dough and add additional water or flour, if necessary. At end of cycle, remove, shape, and let rise until approximately doubled. Bake in preheated 350 deg. Oven. For app. 30 to 40 minute.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a large glass baking dish with foil,. Put the ground beef in a large bowl and add the onion and garlic, knead together, add bread crumbs and italian seasoning -- mix all together. Add the egg and milk -- knead together well with hands --. Form pieces of meat into 1 inch balls, place in baking dish -- bake for about 20-30 minutes --. I usually put them in a large pan on the stove and cover with spaghetti sauce for a few minutes at medium heat, but thats optional.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic, vinegar, water, oil, mustard, salt and pepper. Cook until fragrant, about 5 minutes. Add the shallot vert and cook until fragrant, about 5 minutes. Add the shallot

Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Unroll crescent rolls into 4 rectangles and place in a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Press up sides slightly and press perforations together. Layer cooked bacon, bacon, hash browns, and cheese. At this point you can make it ahead and refrigerate for up to 24 hours. Mix together eggs, milk, salt and pepper. Pour mixture over the dish. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes.

In microwave, heat butter and garlic over medium heat until butter melts. Remove from heat. Brush chicken pieces with garlic butter, then roll in bread crumb mixture to coat. Place chicken skin side up on a large foil-lined baking sheet. Mix together any remaining crumb mixture and butter and sprinkle over chicken. Mix together any remaining cr

In a large pot of salted boiling water, cook angel hair pasta until it is al dente, about 8 to 10 minutes. Drain, and set aside. In a large pot of salted boiling water, cook angel hair pasta until it is al dente, about 8 to 10 minutes.

Place the fritz martini in a chilled martini glass. Add the blue cheese, green olives, gin, dry vermouth, and a handful of ice. Shake well, then strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish the fritz martini with a cucumber slice and the remaining whole olives and serve.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Spray a 9 inch pie plate with non stick vegetable spray. Add graham crumbs and shake the plate to coat the entire surface. Set aside. In a separate bowl, combine cream cheese, sugar and flour. Beat on medium speed until thoroughly mixed and creamy. Beat in sour cream, egg whites and vanilla. Pour mixture into graham crust and place in center of preheated oven. Bake for 45 minutes or until edges are brown. Turn oven off and let cheesecake cool in oven for 1 hour. Remove to wire rack to cool. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving.

Preheat oven to 325f. Mix flour and corn. Then add sugar, milk, salt and butter. Add eggs and mix well. Pour corn mixture into a greased 1 quart casserole dish. Place casserole into a larger pan and fill the larger pan half way up with hot water. Bake for 1 hour in the 325f oven.

Place all ingredients in a food processor fitted with a metal blade and process just until mixture is powdery -- about 30 seconds. Be careful not to overprocess. Store in an airtight container for up to 6 months. To make brandied white hot chocolate, combine 1 cup of milk and 2 tablespoons of the mix in a small saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium-low heat, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and add in vanilla. Whisk until frothy. Pour into warmed mugs. Garnish with whipped cream.

Melt butter in a large skillet on medium heat. Add pork chops. Cook 5 minutes on each side or until cooked. Remove pork chop from skillet. Add watr, applesauce, apple, cinnamon to skillet. Stir. Bring to a boil. Stir in rice. Top with chops. Cover and cook on low heat for 5 minutes

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease roasting pan or cake pan using nonstick spray. Mix all ingredients together, and toss until all vegetables are coated with olive oil and spices. Spread vegetables into pan. Bake 45 minutes, removing from the oven and stirring twice during cooking. For crisper vegetables, cut cooking time a few minutes shorter. Switch oven setting to broiler. Place pan under the broiler for 7-10 minutes, sliding out and stirring vegetables once or twice.

Preheat oven to 325f degrees. Spray an 8-inch square baking pan with nonstick cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine oats, peaches and sugar. In another bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Beat with a fork or wire whisk until blended. Add to oat mixture, mixing well. Place mixture in prepared pan. Bake, uncovered, 50 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350f. Spray oven with vegetable spray. Add ground beef and onions and cook until beef is no longer pink. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Cover and reduce heat to simmer for 20 to 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix ingredients together in a large bowl until well-blended. Roll peanut butter mixture into tablespoon size balls. Bake 12 minutes for chewy cookies. Bake 15 minutes for crisp.

Place potatoes in an 8 inch square baking dish which has been wiped down with shortening or sprayed with pam. Potatoes will thaw over night in the fridge. Sprinkle dish with cheese, ham and onions. In a separate bowl, beate eggs, evaporated milk, pepper and salt together. Pour into baking dish over the potato mixture. Cover and refridgerate for several hours or overnight. Remove from refridgerator 30 minutes before baking. Bake, uncovered, at 350 for 55-60 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Heat the oil in a large skillet and brown the chicken pieces on all sides for about 15 minutes. Remove the chicken to a large casserole. In the same oil saute the garlic and onions until golden, then stir in the tomatoes, white wine, chopped parsley, salt, and a little black and red pepper. Simmer over low heat for about 10 minutes, then pour over the chicken in the casserole. Now cover and place the casserole in the oven for 1 hour. While the chicken cooks, prepare whatever pasta you desire and serve with the chicken peices and sauce poured over.

In a large, resealable plastic bag, or shallow glass container, combine the first seven ingredients and mix well. Add steak, turn to coat. Seal bag, or cover container, and refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight, turning occasionally. Drain and discard marinade. Grill, covered, over medium-hot coals for 6-8 minutes on each side, or until meat reaches desired doneness.

In a large bowl, combine all the ingredients in a medium saucepan. Cook over low heat, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking, for about 15 mins. Or until the mixture is of desired consistency. Pour into sterilized jars and seal. Store processor marmalade in a cool place.

In a large skillet, heat oil over medium high heat and cook the garlic until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add tomatoes and red pepper flakes and cook about 2 minutes. Season calamari rings with salt and pepper, then add to the skillet. Saute, stirring, until cooked through, about 2 or 3 minutes. Transfer to a colander to drain a bit. Place the lemon juice, olive oil, capers, and lemon zest into a clean glass jar with a lid. Shake to combine, taste, and season with salt and pepper. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Preheat oven to 350 f. In a small mixing bowl, beat the eggs with a splash of water. On a plate combine breadcrumbs and thyme. Then on another plate combine flour with a pinch of salt and pepper. Lay ham strips on work surface, top each slice with cheese then place chicken chink toward the end of the strip. Roll up lightly, and coat with flour, eggs and breadcrumbs. Cook for 20 mins or until done.

Heat oven to 425 degrees f. Heat a heavy-based oven roasting pan on top of the stove and toss the vegetables and garlic. Sprinkle with the oil. Stir until they start to brown. Add the herbs, sprinkle over the vinegar and season well. Put the pan in the oven and roast for about 15 minutes, then reduce the heat to 375 degrees f and continue cooking for another 30 minutes or so, stirring 2 or 3 times until the beets are tender. If the vegetables start to burn, add a little more oil and vinegar to the pan.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees fahrenheit. Grease a 13x9x2 inch pan. Unroll dough. Press in bottom and 1 inch up sides of greased pan. Place pieces of string cheese along the inside edges of dough. Fold the 1 inch of dough over and around the cheese. Bake at 425 degrees fahrenheit for 15 to 18 minutes or until crust is golden brown and cheese is melted.

Heat oven to 450f. Place pizza crust onto ungreased baking sheet. Melt butter in 8-inch skillet until sizzling. Add chicken and garlic powder. Cook over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until chicken is no longer pink. Stir in salsa. Spread evenly onto crust. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until cheese is lightly browned and bubbly.

Heat the oil in a large pan then add the chicken seasoning with salt and pepper. Cook until the chicken is golden and the juices evaporate approximately 10 minutes. Add the garlic and shallots sauteing until tender. Add the wine and scrape up all the brown bits at the bottom of the pan. Add the marinara sauce and rosemary mixing well. Reduce heat to medium low and simmer gently for 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease an 8 x 4 inch loaf pan and dust with powdered sugar, shaking off excess. Whip the cream until stiff. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Sift together the remaining ingredients and add to the cream mixture. Stir to combine. Spoon batter into the prepared pan and bake in the preheated oven for 45-55 minutes, or until the cake just begins to pull from the edges of the pan. Cool the cake in the pan for 10 minutes before turning out on rack. The cake will keep in the fridge for up to a week wrapped air-tightly in plastic wrap and foil.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line muffin pan with foil baking cups. Cut almond paste into 16 pieces and pat into a round disc. In mixer cream butter and sugar until fluffy. Beat in eggs then add baking powder, soda and extract. Fold in 1 cup flour, buttermilk then remaining flour until well blended. Spoon about 2 tablespoons batter into each cup and smooth surface. Top with level teaspoonful of preserves, then the piece of almond paste. Top each muffin with another 2 tablespoons of batter. Bake 25 minutes or until lightly brown.

Heat oil in l skillet over medium high heat until oil is shimmering and then add the orzo. Toast, stirring frequently, until it starts to turn golden brown. Stir in broth and bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until orzo is tender and broth is absorbed. Remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Uncover and stir in butter, salt, peper and parsley.

Mix all ingredients together. Pour into greased bundt pan. Bake at 335 degrees between 40 - 50 minutes. This is how this cake turns out best in my oven. Start looking at the cake at 35-40 minutes to see if it finished. It should be light to medium brown and mostly set when jiggled.

Heat 2 tbs oil in small skillet, hold tortilia with tongs, dip one at a time in oil, for ten seconds, or until limp. Line a 10x6x2 inch baking dish with the tortilias. Keep warm. In same skillet add 2tbs oil and cook onion and garlic till tender. Stir in tomatoes, green chillies, and salt. Simmer 10 min. Pour over tortilias. Beat eggs and cook in skillet till set, put on top, and grate cheese on top. Put in oven just long enough for cheese to melt.
Heat oil in a saut pan over medium heat, add the garlic and cook until golden. Add the apples and saut until the outsides are just browned. Stir through the basil leaves and pine nuts and serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a medium bowl, whisk eggs until well beaten and slightly frothy. Whisk in milk, chives and black pepper. Set aside. In a large skillet, heat olive oil or butter over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Add egg mixture to skillet and then quickly arrange remaining ingredients on top of eggs. Cook for 3 minutes on the stovetop without stirring. Transfer to oven. Bake until the top is golden brown and the frittata is set, about 30 minutes. Let cool slightly before serving.

Cook noodles in a large pot of lightly salted water until al dente. While the pasta is cooking, place the eggs, grated cheese, parsley, salt and pepper into a mixing bowl and beat with a whisk until well combined. When the noodles are almost cooked, melt the butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Quickly drain the pasta and add it to the skillet. Toss briefly to coat it with the butter.
